latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 54 (Monday, April 2, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. MARSHALL:H.R. 5424.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article IV, Section 3, Clause 2The constitutional authority of Congress to enact thislegislation is provided by Article IV, Section 3, Clause 2 ofthe United States Constitution, which grants Congress thepower to dispose of and make all needful Rules andRegulations respecting the Territory or other Propertybelonging to the United States.[Page H3055]

item.title: To authorize the Society of the First Infantry Division to make modifications to the First Division Monument located on Federal land in Presidential Park, District of Columbia, and for other purposes.
First Division Monument Modification Act
item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
